website_summaries.verdict: The ideal pick for buyers needing a flexible, colorful filament for their 3D printer.
pros: Unique flexible filament makes for a crack-resistant product
Compatible with a slew of different 3D printer brands
Option to purchase in white for a neutral-colored spool
cons: Online instructions are incorrect  for some printers
A little inconsistent when compared to PLA filaments

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and price
customer_reviews.text: The print came out very smooth! I am very new to 3d printing and this was my first time using this material. I printed on an Ender 3pro. I printed at a speed of 26 with 100%fill, and a skirt build plate. I also printed at the default temperature of 200. For this build I did not use any support as it wasnt necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Rayne

customer_reviews.title: Great printing filament for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleasantly surprised by YOYI TPU filament. It prints great! I have now printed 5 spools of Green and Red so far and have some white on the way. This is now my go to TPU
customer_reviews.author: Mike Flys

customer_reviews.title: Easy to print.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this with my monoprice miniv2. Works flawlessly with a 3d printed extruder guide. It might even work without it but the guide was such a quick print I didn't bother to find out. Sticks fine to glass (which is the best and easiest upgrade you can do to a mp mini). Great for toys. Different numbers of perimeters and fills will give more or less squish. They are much more tactilely satisfying than toys printed in PLA. I also printed anti scratch/slip chair feet. They're better than the ones you can buy. This stuff is durable.
customer_reviews.author: anon576

customer_reviews.title: Great squishy material at a very good price.
customer_reviews.text: I got this material for making cell phone cases. TPU is use for applications where there might be high impact, so it should be a good choice. The filament is a bit tricky to work with if you don't have your machine perfectly dialed in. After re-adjusting the gap between the extruder & the hot end feed tube, the filament blow outs stopped. It worked best at a layer height of 0.3mm. Designs are a bit tricky because the material is so flexible.
customer_reviews.author: Fred T. Dunaway

customer_reviews.title: Unexpected Outcome
customer_reviews.text: I really did not expect to be able to print flexible filament on my ancient Davnci 1.0 but this filament printed easily. Shockingly so. There were some issues loading the filament simply because the extruder speed was too high for automatic loading. After hand loading the filament until it came out of the nozzle at ~220C, I started the first print at 10mm/s for all speeds, Great result first time out - zero issues. Printed a second part at 15mm/s and again was impressed with the result. Will test at higher speeds over time but for now, I am very happy with the outcome. This filament worked well on an old machine with 5 year old direct drive extruder.
customer_reviews.author: Deon

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I have two printers running nearly 24/7 for professional purposes and have tried MANY brands of TPU. Only YOYI and Sainsmart have truly delivered on great results. It's wound well (not tying itself in nots), has consistent thickness, and is very flexible. Bought this with my fingers crossed (no reviews at the time) and I'm super impressed. Will be buying much more.
customer_reviews.author: Blair Maynes

customer_reviews.title: Great all-around TPU
customer_reviews.text: YOYI was the first TPU I tried on my CR-10s and I fell in love. Now I've gone through a roll of black, got another and a roll of this red. I have been using this primarily for action camera mounts and protectors, as it's more visible than black. It's firm enough when printed thick and solid, to protect cameras well, but can also be quite squishy when needed. My goto TPU, I was sad to see the price go up on it lately but I guess that's what I get for recommending it to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: J. Airington

customer_reviews.title: Good TPU for a good price.
customer_reviews.text: This TPU feels very soft on the roll, but it prints well. I like it better than the sainsmart TPU which was orange/transparent color I previously used. This one works well and has pretty good print quality on my Ender 5. Using some profiles from Print3D.world website, which are 220* Hotend / 70* Bed. Initial Layer should always be 0.3mm and the retraction should be 0 for bowden and under 1mm for direct drive. Fan was always 100% on my printer. If you want budget friendly black TPU without paying for Ninja Flex this is the way to go!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Go Slow
customer_reviews.text: This started off bad. Was having real difficulties getting this to print, strings everywhere and not sticking to surface. I slowed the print speed down to 20. I keep the nozzle at 210 and the bed at 50. Start by slowing everything down and not making too hot that it is just a stringy mess. This is gonna take some settings tweaks to get to print right, so be patient. Also best thing I did was pick up the dial indicator from Harbor freight and print out the extruder attachement to make sure the bed is perfectly level. $15 dollar item made things much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Dabizmike

customer_reviews.title: So far I enjoy the filament
customer_reviews.text: So far I enjoy the filament. Using a Wanhao Duplicator i3 Plus with this is pretty easy. It has a direct feed to the nozzle which is preferable for flexible filaments. As far as settings go Im using a nozzle temp of 200 C and a bed temp of 60. Still experimenting with the temps so far. note, in some places online it says to use a nozzle temp of 220 or so. This produces micro bubbles in the filament giving it a more opaque look and a stiffer finished product, hence my 200 C recommendation currently.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OK but Caution
customer_reviews.text: Arrived as scheduled and it prints well actually. The only downside I have with it is that being such a large heavy spool the extruder can't rotate it well enough to keep printing and you end up with a bit of a jam inside the extruder as it stretches the filament. 6 hours of print time wasted. I ended up winding some on an old small spool I had and it fixed the problem. I have a picture of the filament issue but can't seem to find where to upload as there's nothing in the product description that states "upload image".
customer_reviews.author: Skidda

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is great!
customer_reviews.text: I like the print adhesion that I have using this filament but I think that comes natural with TPU, I really like the fact that it is almost transparent or see through. And I dried my spool at 62°C for 6hr and had no problems with moisture in my filament. Only a 800g spool but it makes up for it with filament quality and definitely the amazing color. I print at 220°C at between 10-15mm speeds and prints look great with very little strings. Also looks knda glossy which I think is a nice touch to the color.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Faircloth

customer_reviews.title: TPU clear awesome stuff
customer_reviews.text: This is great stuff. I did my first print of a phone case and it was getting stuck (informed of tube feed near gear/roller feeder) solved. Anyway, I hand fed the line for 3 hours and I messed up on one whole sweep and there was a tiny gap across the sheet. when it was done, didn't print picture clear, the thing fit my phone like a store bought case stretched it on easy. after printing this filament was frickin strong and wouldn't let go of the weakened half.
customer_reviews.author: 808mama

customer_reviews.title: Jams (Bowden)
customer_reviews.text: First, a caveat – I have a Bowden extruder and Bowden extruders typically have trouble with TPU. Even with the extruder temperature turned way up to 249°C, and the speed slowed way down, this filament tends to jam after about an hour of printing. The SainSmart TPU filament has no jamming problem for me. In fact, I can print SainSmart successfully even after turning the speed back up to 50% of my PLA speed. If you have a Bowden extruder, I would recommend the SainSmart TPU over this TPU. I have successfully printed small parts, taking around an hour or less, with this filament, but I don’t recommend the filament.
customer_reviews.author: D. C. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Diameter variation
customer_reviews.text: Despite what the text says, the diameter of this filament is all over the place. Diameter varied from 1.75 to 1.58 in the first meter. That's 170 microns, compared to an advertised 30 microns. I don't know how well it prints as I didn't realize I'd need a different bowden tube for this filament. That's my fault, and did not affect my rating.
customer_reviews.author: srs

customer_reviews.title: Prints on Anet A8 with bowden tube
customer_reviews.text: I use a Bowden setup on my Anet A8 and can print with this. I only added a small part to my extruder to prevent binding and it has been printing very well without major tuning. Current settings are 210C nozzle, no heat on the bed (using buildtak/similar adhesive), 30mm/s travel, and no retraction. I am using a 4mm brim because my sheet is getting pretty worn out, but on a fresh sheet I probably wouldn't need it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, amazingly bright under UV light!
customer_reviews.text: This TPU filament is great. I've had no issues printing with it. It feeds perfectly on my printer and the diameter so far has been in-spec any where I've checked. Also this green fluoresces amazingly brightly under UV light!
customer_reviews.author: Who's on First

customer_reviews.title: Incorrectly advertised
customer_reviews.text: This product is NOT 85A shore hardness as advertised and is NOT anywhere comparable to Ninjaflex. It is much more comparable to something of 95A shore hardness. While it’s pretty flexible, there is almost no elasticity to it. That being said, it’s prints great, no complaints there. But if you’re looking for something comparable to Ninjaflex, this is certainly not it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, but difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: I really like the way this filament looks. It is a little difficult to work with though. I wasn't able to print at the low end of the recommended extruder temperature range (200C) without the filament buckling and causing the print to fail. Printing at 210C worked and produced a very nice finish, but caused excess stringing. The flexible transparent red filament from YOYI did not have this problem.
customer_reviews.author: SushiDrone

customer_reviews.title: Questionable quality control.
customer_reviews.text: Edit 8/14/18: after about 1/8th to 1/4 of the spool had printed, the diameter wildly started changing, causing multiple failures to print. After the fourth failure, I gave up and threw the remainder away. I was worried that the bowden setup on the ender 3 wouldn't like this as it's pretty floppy and soft, but it works awesome! The color is amazing, and it has so far printed fantastically. Will be buying more when this runs out, as it works so well.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Smith

customer_reviews.title: Impressively strong!
customer_reviews.text: It has a bit more flex than a zip-tie for the same dimension, but not rubber band flex or elasticity, however in very thin shell items I can get a 2:1 stretch before failure of the material. Appears as it will make good flex joints and high pressure seals for prototyping....Seams to print well at slower travels (40mm/s) and nozzle at 220 bed 60.YMMV Printing on Ender 3x and Tru-Lev.
customer_reviews.author: RW-Ranch

customer_reviews.title: Working fine with a D-Bot CoreXY
customer_reviews.text: Printing this on a D-Bot CoreXY bowden style printer, E3D hot end .4mm and Bondtech QR extruder. Working very well at 15mm/s, no problems so far at all. Printing on a PEI sheet at 70C at 220C, I find it tends to stick really strongly, so a bit of care is needed to remove to avoid damage to the print. I have been doing 4 solid layers top/bottom to give it some strength to reduce damage when removing from the PEI. If I print any faster, I find I don't get the layers and cleanly as I'd like. You will get some stringiness, but easily removed.
customer_reviews.author: Mike L

customer_reviews.title: My first try with Flexible filament and I'm very happy.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first flex filament so I don't have much experience but I am very happy with this filament. Printed slow (15mm/s) at 230F the print came out strong, tough, looking like ice (not see through but semi-transparent white). The bumper case print was very flexible but not at all stretchy - so it bends but does not stretch. I also printed (by accident) a 2 & 3 layer sheet (so 0.4 and 0.6mm thick sheet) and that too is very flexible but almost zero stretch.
customer_reviews.author: jtmoderate876

customer_reviews.title: Kinda hard to work with.
customer_reviews.text: I would give it 5 stars, but this is a hard filament to work with. Some prints come out as good as it gets, then others make you wanna toss your printer out of the house. It is not flexible at all unless you print with very little infill, and you do have to avoid long strands in the open. I printed a benchy boat with this at 300% and the inside of the roof drooped and you could see each and every run of the extruder. It was flexible, but you do have to really dial it in and that make take a minute.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: highly recommended. No printing issues after modding my machine for flexible filaments.
customer_reviews.text: I been using it with my monoprice maker select plus. My machine was updated to help with the clogging by printing a "Wanhao Extruder Plate for Flexible Filament", microswiss all metal hot end and Diicooler fan. I have used their transparent red and solid black printing at 20mm/s and 210C. no clogs or bed adhesion issues so far. Highly recommenced.
customer_reviews.author: Aarod

customer_reviews.title: This TPU is amazing stuff.
customer_reviews.text: "This TPU is amazing stuff. flexible filament that produces good results.The finished product is very flexible and will stretch or bend a long way before coming apart.Its the only 3D printing material that I cannot tear apart by hand. Probably best printed with an extruder mounted to the head, but I printed using a bowden system. Retract doesn't work because of the flexible nature of the filament. Make sure the distance between your extruder gear and nozzle is as small as possible otherwise it will buckle up. print temp 220c bed: 60 speed: 15 mm/s. Works great, no jams!"
customer_reviews.author: nruzi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent TPU filament!
customer_reviews.text: I've been really happy with YOYI's TPU filaments. This is the 3rd color of theirs I've used and it works perfectly for me. The diameter is consistent and within spec wherever I've checked as I use it and I've never had any extruder feed issues with any of them. Finished prints are tough and durable while still retaining excellent flexibility.
customer_reviews.author: Who's on First

customer_reviews.title: works great!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great as long and you are patient and get the settings just right. I have all my speeds at 20mms, retraction is the only one I kept at recommended 40mms, temp at 215°c, and bed temp to 60°c. This is a jigglypuff that was used as a nightlight. I had to use 0% infill with 4 walls so that it would not bend on itself.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar

customer_reviews.title: Neat
customer_reviews.text: Been making some cool stuff with this! Note, it’s too flimsy for a mini catapult, but the regular filament is too stiff, so we are going to try a third type for that. This is great for little toys or to make things that just look cool, but I wouldn’t recommend it for a phone case as it’s too flimsy for that too unless it’s a 2 part one with a hard shell, and this is for the inside layer. Probably great for shock absorbing. We made some nice grippy feet for our printer with it.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Bag Punctured Upon Arrival
customer_reviews.text: The seal was busted and the top of the bag had a hole in it. Filament works but I have no idea how long it has been punctured exposed to air. While it is in the description I have no idea why this is a .8kg spool vs a standard 1kg spool. This filament is crystal clear and prints very well. Just wish the bag was not punctured when arrived. This doesnt seem to be any better or worse than other TPU I have used in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Mech

customer_reviews.title: Working well on modified Ender3
customer_reviews.text: Managed to successfully print TPU multirotor parts on my Ender 3 Pro modified with the EZR Extruder. No retraction, no supports, 210C end temperature and 70C bed temperature on a glass bed. Still experimenting for optimal settings but those produced good initial results. Not bad for a material (TPU) known to be difficult to print, especially on Bowden-type printers. I did have some bed adhesion issues but I suspect those are temperature related and will improve as I tweak the settings. Some minor stringing but that's to be expected with no retraction. Overall I'm happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Edgardo Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Amazed, Prints well 210/60
customer_reviews.text: I fired this up on an old A8 with no real tweaks other than a slower speed. Very satisfied with results. Amazed actually. This stuff presents itself as shiny when done. Has the strength of a rubber foot or the sole of shoe. Very impressive stuff you will find a use for it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great TPU
customer_reviews.text: Printed out a lens cover for my trailer hitch light cover. Came out perfect! Seems to flow pretty well. Settings 200C nozzle, 60C Bed, 0.4mm Speed 40mm\s perimeter, 80mm\s infill One reviewer describe the toughness of leather, that's very accurate! This stuff is flexible but freaking hard (if not impossible) to tear apart! I'm a YOYI fan now.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Super easy, prints beautifully!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic flexible filament! I’ve been printing with it at 230 degrees on my BIBO2 touch with just a glue stick applied under it and haven’t had a failure or knot yet. It’s a bit stringy but that’s easily corrected with a heat gun. This is one of my favorites to use because people love the squish of it and it’s just so easy. I’ve also printed several strain reliefs for charging cables with it and they’ve all come out perfectly, a huge money saver.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Solid quality TPU
customer_reviews.text: I used this filament to print a compliant mechanism that would secure itself by springing outward once pushed through an opening. The filament worked as predicted and has nice flexibility and seems to work just as well as some more pricey TPU I’ve purchased in the past. It’s a little stringy, but that’s tough to eliminate entirely with TPU. Bed adhesion was strong on my Prusa MK3. I forgot to protect the bed with a layer of glue or hairspray, but the print did not damage my bed’s surface, fortunately.
customer_reviews.author: ZombieDeity

customer_reviews.title: Great TPU.  Print it slow WITHOUT retractions.
customer_reviews.text: The last roll of TPU that I used with Amazon Basics. Now that Amazon does not make TPU, I decided to use this brand. I used these setting on my stock CR-10S: 220 hot end 60 bed 25 mm/s ZERO retraction(this is very important) .2 layer height I will be purchasing more.
customer_reviews.author: Jerad Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Great flexible film. no issues printing with upgraded Machine.
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to print flexible filament after reading so many issues people are having. Before I jumped into it I upgraded to the all metal microSwiss hot end, the Extruder Plate for Flexible Filament, and the Dii diiiCooler on my Monoprice Maker select plus. After calibration, I have printed 3 pieces with this filament with no issues. I have printed at 200, 205 and 210 and so far all look great.
customer_reviews.author: Aarod

customer_reviews.title: Easiest TPU filament ever
customer_reviews.text: This is The best TPU I have ever printed with nice and flexible incredible finish beautiful color I printed it at 205°C with my bed at 60°C printing on a glass plate, i'm using a dual gear extruder with a Boeing tube this stuff is amazing I cannot wait to try the other colors
customer_reviews.author: ANgel K

customer_reviews.title: Easy filament to work with!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been very happy with this filament. I was looking for some TPU to print phone cases and a number of other filaments just wouldn’t adhere and I had to jack the temps up to ABS temps or higher and still no luck. Not with the YOYI, it printed at the temps quoted on the box and had great adhesion. It was super easy to work with. I really love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy F

customer_reviews.title: Prusa Mini w/ Generic Flex slicer settings worked great!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time ever printing TPU. I did not expect it to work after reading all of the issues people have with TPU, and with my Prusa Mini being a bowden setup. Loaded up the filament into the printer, found the Generic FLEX settings in Prusa Slicer & changed the nozzle temp to 220 (according to YOYI recommendations). I used the textured PEI sheet & first layer laid down great! I didnt adjust the nozzle height any from the PETG height I was using just before using TPU. There was a very minimal amount of stringing, like just a few strands after the print was complete. Looking forward to using the rest of the roll.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great TPU!
customer_reviews.text: This was the first TPU filament I have printed, and it worked great on my Ender 3 Pro. I used the settings described by a couple of the previous purchasers, and I was somehow able to get perfect prints the first try. This is the perfect material for tires. Cura Settings: Used General TPU 95A Filament Setting, then modified to slow down the print speed to 20mm/s. 20% infill, 228C nozzle temp and 50 bed temp. Enable Retraction unchecked, and Combing Mode set to All.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and strength
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works perfect. I use a Dremel 3D20 with layer set at .2 and temp between 200c-250c. Infill at 20% 200c produced slightly softer parts while 250c is the sweet spot for FPV Drone parts. I do not use a heated bed. I basically use the same exact settings for PLA parts. It's nice to not have to change anything except the spool. I highly recommend this stuff. I'm going to buy more colors of the same.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: great prints, with patience
customer_reviews.text: This was my first attempt at flexible filament. My printer uses direct drive, but I fitted a PTFE insert into my hotend below the hobbed bolt. After tweaking my settings, I was able to get this to print beautifully. - slow print speed (10 mm/s) - heated bed (50deg) - 230 deg nozzle - no retraction I'll be buying more YOYI filament
customer_reviews.author: P. Bultmann

customer_reviews.title: Great flex filament
customer_reviews.text: I haven't actually tried this color but I love their white. I've tried 3 different brands of TPU, SainSmart, Filamentum, and YOYI, and YOYI is the only one I've came back to get more of. The other two brands were decent but the YOYI was easier to print, more flexible, and made cleaner parts. I also believe it was cheaper!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Meister

customer_reviews.title: I like this material
customer_reviews.text: I bought this material to test out printing TPU on my newest 3d printer. It prints really well, slightly stringy, but otherwise its fantastic. Printed a phone case out of this and it has been going strong for a couple of months now and I get a lot of compliments on it. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Ross

customer_reviews.title: Really nice TPU.
customer_reviews.text: You really need to dial in your settings for this filament, but I’ve had no issues really once I’ve done that on my Ender 3. Having a skirt around your part helps to further clean your nozzle before the print starts. Small retraction settings help and 100% fan speed.
customer_reviews.author: Kal

customer_reviews.title: Yoyi Transparent Filament no successful prints
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to be able to make some parts using TPU but after many hours and modifications to my 3d printer, I couldn't get a good print. I tryed using different temperatures of the bed (30-50 degrees Celsius) , different temperatures of nozzle (190-220 degrees Celsius) , speed settings (20-40mm/s), nozzle sizes, and tips from the seller. I tryed whatever I was able to find by using the internet and no glory.
customer_reviews.author: DagDerNiT

customer_reviews.title: Gray-ish
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one because it looked dark gray on a product photo, which is exactly what I needed for a project at hand. However, the spool I received was a very light gray, almost white... like an ash from the incense stick.
customer_reviews.author: Trent

customer_reviews.title: cool stuff
customer_reviews.text: very flexible and strong i only wish it maintains its original translucency better. the filament if almost water clear but the prints come out semi translucent. it's cool stuff anyway with a lot of fun applications.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Goodwin

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: It seems that most of their filaments are black and shiny.If that's what you want, great.Very easy to print, I used standard Settings for my typical filaments and my results are as follows, extremely technical on the right.On the left are the other brands.When the nozzle diameter is the same, the height difference of the filament laser line of different machines is small.If I wanted to buy something shiny, I would definitely buy it again.My other threads don't shine as brightly as this goose does to them.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: A little too flexible for stock Ender 3
customer_reviews.text: This filament is ok. I print on an Ender 3 with a few small mods to make printing flexi filament easier. I had some underextrusion issues with this filament but I can’t really blame the filament completely. It is definitely flexible and clear. I liked my solutech green better but this one is not too bad either.
customer_reviews.author: Terri D.

customer_reviews.title: Seems like fairly good quality TPU
customer_reviews.text: I really like the color selection on this TPU filament. It's a little stringy and can leave some bumps on the print that are a little hard to remove, but that's the nature of TPU. Color remains translucent after printing.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great TPU
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the YOYI TPU products. I have tried all the colors except for black so far. I have had 1 issue after using maybe 5 rolls so far. Came home to a printer jam, found the TPU diameter had gone from 1.71mm to 2.18mm. Hopefully this won't happen again.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor J. Mcintosh

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: First print so far is great! Though the package had a leak and was not airtight when it arrived. I did not notice anything wrong while printing so far so I do not think it absorbed moisture while shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Dang

customer_reviews.title: Used to be my favorite filament but the quality has gone way down and the price way up.
customer_reviews.text: This used to by my favorite filament to make functional parts with but recently (along with a $5 price increase) the spools that I have ordered have not arrived in vacuum sealed bags and because of that they have a lot of moisture in them making the filament useless right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: T. McClelland

customer_reviews.title: Tricky but good
customer_reviews.text: It took me a while to figure this out, but it prints well if you go slow and hot. For me on my ender 5 I use 37.5mm per second, 220 hot end and a 60 degree bed. I also use settings to keep the nozzle inside the print area and retraction at 25mm/s for 7mm.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Donaldson

customer_reviews.title: Violet TPU wet, bad quality control
customer_reviews.text: A week ago I purchased the green filament from yoyi and it ended up being my favorite TPU I've used this far out of tronxy and sainsmart. So I decided to buy the violet as well, and sadly after opening the sealed bag and running a few test cubes I realized the filament was wet. I don't have a dehydrater yet so I'm pretty bummed because I was supposed to make a few products for some people.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Prints great. Very uniform and nice resiliency. With a little cleaning up after, I can print multiple items on same job 230-240 temp, zero retraction, low-med fan, 60 bed, hairspray on glass, 15mm/s speed, direct drive extruder
customer_reviews.author: Shinondon

customer_reviews.title: Good TPU for the price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this stuff for my Ender-5 more out of curiosity than anything. With the proper print settings it works pretty well, even with the Ender-5's bowden setup. Print speed needs to be slowed to ~30mm/s and all forms of retraction need to be turned off (There's actually two options you need to tick in CURA). I found 210C to be the sweet spot for squishiness/quality for this stuff. The overall prints are a little tougher than I was originally hoping for, however that's a problem with TPU and not this specific filament.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher King

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Ender 3
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite performing filaments for my Ender 3. I've printed Roomba wheels, keyboard wrist rests, MacBook docks & all sorts of random thing. Not only does this filament print great but it's also very durable. Can't recommend enough!
customer_reviews.author: customer839

customer_reviews.title: its not bad
customer_reviews.text: it could be my printer but some thing about it just didnt blend right, i have used others and had some good luck with it, and i know theres a lot of factors in it to, and when i say its not bad i would buy again and try it out, maybe it was the color update, so i think its the green color, have other colors that work just fine, so i will stay away from the green
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Flabbergasted
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for filament the consistency of flabber. After looking for quite some time I finally isolated this as the ideal companion. After testing everything out I decided this is exactly what I was pursuing, leaving me flabbergasted.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Love the stuff
customer_reviews.text: Prints like butter if you have the right settings would appreciate a recommended print temperature on the spool label or the box but prints well on 220 so pretty good also glows under blacklight no it doesn't glow in the dark that stuff ruins nozzles its fluorescent/neon
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time i tried TPU and must say WOWIE!!! It mostly prints like PLA other than retraction needs to be turned OFF. Plus print speeds needs to be below 40mm/s. I need to find the perfect speed to print. Regardless, am rather impressed with this company's filament.
customer_reviews.author: Jazzkin2001

customer_reviews.title: It's really nice once you dial it in.
customer_reviews.text: I did not know this was was transparent red and it presented some issues. Like everyone says and I was starting to doubt. Once you get your settings in place it does print very nice. For me on the CR-10s it was 230 c for the nozzle, 0 for the bed, layer height was .3mm, infill 100%, speed 25 mm/s and retraction was 0. Once I finally got those all right, and it did take me awhile, it started printing consistently without errors.
customer_reviews.author: GrandPappyMike

customer_reviews.title: Happy happy happy.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty blown away with how this performed. Super easy to print with on my prusa i3 mk2. I printed these feet for my ikea lack enclosure and they turned out great. Using 205c nozzle 40c bed, 1mm at 20mm/s retraction and .2mm layer height. With 40% infill, something to keep in mind is if you have a flat top this will kind of sag in where there are no supports directly below. (Hence the 40%infill) also supports stick all too well so you will want to cut away with an exacto knife rather than tear away.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Great TPU filament at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to give this TPU a try when Hatchbox was sold out. My other 'go-to' TPU is Sainsmart but the price was right for the Yoyi and I figured I'd give it a shot. The first print I used soem gcode I had on the card from a print I've been printing in Blue SainSmart TPU and it printed perfect! I'm a Yoyi TPU fan now!
customer_reviews.author: S. QUINN

customer_reviews.title: This Filament is a Dream to Print with
customer_reviews.text: I now print TPU exclusively with YOYI TPU Filament. I have ran every color they offer through my Flashforge Creator pro, Perfect prints everytime. I have tried two other brands of TPU, had great results with one color but horrible results with a different color of same brand. The other brand I had success with, but it was finicky & had to be perfect settings, Also had to be a good part, meaning it didn't bridge well or print thin sections well. This YOYI filament IMO is the best all around TPU that I have used. For sure I recommend this filament.
customer_reviews.author: Carter

customer_reviews.title: High Moisture Content, must be dehydrated.
customer_reviews.text: High moisture content causes bubbles in my prints, after dehydration at 118deg for 6hrs my prints turn out great. I'd expect better stores filament though. Will I buy again? Yes...maybe
customer_reviews.author: J. E. Claiborne

customer_reviews.title: Works fine. Less rubbery than I had hoped.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to use the same settings as standard pls. The prints stick to the bed fairly well with a glue stick. It is a little less rubbery than I expected. Can be quite stringy but all TPUs are.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Very nice TPU filament
customer_reviews.text: So far I am very happy with this filament. It's been working great at 220F on my FlashForge and so far it's by far the easiest type of filament to get perfect prints that I've used. Its also very tough, has very good flexibility, and layer adhesion is great.
customer_reviews.author: Who's on First

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy. Did not work .
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to receive this flexible filament. Unfortunately I was unable to use this filament successfully. It’s like trying to print with angel hair pasta. I am an experienced maker using a hot rodded Ender 3. I would not recommend this filament. You will need an aftermarket high quality extruder installed, which I have. Still no success. The filament is not ridged enough to extrude properly.
customer_reviews.author: Carter Bronson

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This filament was really easy to use on my Prusa i3 MK2S. It is very flexible and it is much easier to work with than high temperature filaments like nylon.
customer_reviews.author: SushiDrone

customer_reviews.title: Mixed results with inconsistent diameter in at least one place.
customer_reviews.text: This is the only tpu I have tried so far, and while it has mostly been good, the diameter of the filiment has been about 1.70mm not 1.75, and I did run into a spot where it got really thin and then really thick right after. I think the thinnest part was probably about 1-1.2mm and the thickest was enough to not fit through the hole in my extruder, so about 2mm. Once I cut that part out it has been working well again for me tho. It looks awesome when printed well.
customer_reviews.author: Cat Wine

customer_reviews.title: Great results
customer_reviews.text: I've used it to print gaskets and face-shield straps for people working with the public during the pandemic. There is a bit of stringing, but that is what TPU does. Overall, good quality. I even bought a second spool as the first one ran out.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Blackthorne

customer_reviews.title: Well packaged great quality filament. Smooth and reliable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as my first flex filament to print camera mounts on my cr-10 mini. It came out better than any tpu print that I've ever seen. I'm going to print a case for my phone with this next because it looks so nice with an amazingly smooth finish! Just make sure to store any tpu in an airtight container with the provided desiccant.
customer_reviews.author: Shane SC

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a good flexible material, purchased to print a replacement roomba wheel
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to use and and get the temp settings correct. Had no problem with warping or bed adhesion. Bought to print a roomba wheel instead of purchasing one. It worked well but the wheel wasn’t as grippy as I wanted it to be. Overall it seemed like a good material
customer_reviews.author: Jared B

customer_reviews.title: Well worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Great filament every time! Use this on my CR-10 S and prints a dream. I have used other, more expensive brands but find this one works best for me. Highly recommended to anyone looking and will be buying again soon. Plus the huge choice of blue
customer_reviews.author: Rabon Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Great Flexible TPU filament for Monoprice Maker Select V2 type 3D printer
customer_reviews.text: This TPU prints great at 224deg /70deg bed temp on my Monoprice Maker Select V2. I have printed tons of drone parts with it so far with very few issues.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Sugano

customer_reviews.title: Nice flexible filament
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted to try some cheap flexible filament on my printer and was really surprised how well it printed. I printed at 60mm/sec and had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: xxsxx

customer_reviews.title: Poor QC
customer_reviews.text: The first purchase of this filament was great. After that it went all down hill. The second purchase I made was for black tpu. What I got instead was Dark Blue. The third purchase was for another roll of Black. What I received was a box labeled Black but Dark Blue inside the box. I also ordered a Clear Green tpu but what I received was Green PTEG. This is highly unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D.

customer_reviews.title: Prints great and weighs more than advertised. Printing on an 80C bed and extruder at 235C. Prints beautifully.
customer_reviews.text: Prints great and weighs more than advertised. Printing on an 80C bed and extruder at 235C. Prints beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Hoogland

customer_reviews.title: Not great, but maybe my 3d printer is not compatible
customer_reviews.text: Hard to get to print without strings. Played with the temp several times, just doesn't print well. I have an Ender 3d printer
customer_reviews.author: Buffy

customer_reviews.title: Quality not as good as previous
customer_reviews.text: This used to be my favorite brand of tpu. Something has changed in the winding process and the spools no longer are consistently working for me. I have both direct drive and Bowden setups...the direct drives actually have more issues now.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor J. Mcintosh

customer_reviews.title: Finicky but neat.
customer_reviews.text: I'm still a beginner at 3d Printing, so mastering the nuances of temperature and print speed will take a little tinkering. On the few small prints that I've tried where things were dialed in, the prints look good and the material is very neat. It's definitely more finicky to work with than PLA.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Wilson

customer_reviews.title: It prints out bright color and good toughness.
customer_reviews.text: Printing effect can, leveling convenient and easy to use, suitable for beginners.It can completely meet the needs of our modeling and proofing, usually I do some handicrafts or model toys for children no longer ask people, I am also a model lover, bought back immediately to try to make a few models, software support is good, also do not block the print out bright color, toughness is good.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Keefe

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff, to be fair it is the only TPU brand I've used, but i am amazed at how well and how easily it prints
customer_reviews.author: John Messenger

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Nice flexible filament, a bit hard to extrude, you have to get the tube close to the feed rollers as it is hard to push flexible material but once you get the extruder adjusted, it prints nice. Sticks to glass and it is super tough.
customer_reviews.author: Joe B.

customer_reviews.title: Good filament for the money
customer_reviews.text: I have been printing with this filament for just over a month now. So far I have had great results. It prints exactly like my higher priced Sainsmart rolls. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Huy N.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality TPU
customer_reviews.text: I print almost exclusively with TPU and it's always hard to get some with the same temperature settings or consistency as hatchbox. But this is on point. Prints out with really great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Zach A.

customer_reviews.title: great tpu filament, the red is beautiful
customer_reviews.text: printed cleanly from the first try. i love the filament. it is *not* opaque, but a translucent red. i run a titan aero hotend, and this filament does well in it.
customer_reviews.author: Silviana

customer_reviews.title: Great flexible squishy quality!
customer_reviews.text: This prints so great! I printed a skull shift knob for my Jeep and it doubles as a stress skull! With a 15% infill I can give it a squeeze or two when I'm mad at other drivers on the road! Love this filament!
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Christie

customer_reviews.title: Very consistent.
customer_reviews.text: More consistent than the rolls of Sainsmart I get. My settings stay the same no matter what color of Yoyi I put in my printer. Not so with other brands. MORE COLORS PLEASE!!
customer_reviews.author: punkindrublk

customer_reviews.title: Excellent !
customer_reviews.text: This TPU is phenominal. Clean prints, doesnt string, minimal calibration was required to obtain superb prints. I will definitely be buying this brand again!
customer_reviews.author: Blade

customer_reviews.title: I bought this on a whim to practice TPU, just happened to be luminous red.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on a whim to practice TPU, just happened to be luminous red. Works fine once your settings are tuned. Printed a wrist computer, a sewing basket tray and a replacement watch strap. Bed 50C, Extruder 220C, speed 40mm/s, Disable retraction, Hairspray on your bed first jobs a good'n. And the support waste is gorgeous in the light when unfolded haha.
customer_reviews.author: Katri

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent strand
customer_reviews.text: prints flexi fine, except when a 12 hr print fails because the thickness is inconsistent. It thinned out so bad that the print is not usable. Went to sleep because all was printing well. Woke up to the pic you see where its solid for the bottom half. Then just terrible. Other than rolling the dice on when this may happen, its pretty good filament.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Printed just like my Sainsmart TPU in my Monoprice Mini
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical given only two other reviews, but decided to save a few bucks and give it a try. Printed just like my Sainsmart TPU in my Monoprice Mini. Highly recommend this filament.
customer_reviews.author: Shmorgishborg

customer_reviews.title: this worked fine
customer_reviews.text: a good alternative to ninjatek? this does ok ninjatek just too $$$
customer_reviews.author: gmart

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality TPU
customer_reviews.text: Great Quality TPU printed fine in my stock Ender 3 Pro
customer_reviews.author: Chris MacClellan

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but stringy bridges form on nearby "towers"
customer_reviews.text: It is good for its flex but if you make 'towers' or nearby buttons (2 separate vertical items in the same print that are close to each other) it leaves stringy connections between the gaps. I've tried different temperatures but it still happens. I have to clean off the prints - time consuming. Other than that it is very good.
customer_reviews.author: JJ R Edmonds

product_meta.title: YOYI TPU 3D Printer Filament,Flexible Filament 1.75mm,100% Virgin Raw Material,0.8KG Spool,Dimensional Accuracy +/- 0.03 mm (Blue)
feature_bullets: About YOYI：As a mature 3d filament enterprise,have strict requirements on 3d filament and always continuous improvement.
Raw Materials：YOYI raw materials are imported from Europe, without any impurities, giving buyers a better experience.
Strict Quality：After strict procedures, no bubbles, ultra smooth technology,little to no odor,precise precision, reaching the REACH standard.
Print Suggestion：Tested for all filaments,please print according to the print temperature we provide(200℃ - 210℃).
After Sale：We are confident in YOYI products. If you are not satisfied or do not meet your expectations, support free return within 30 days.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
